reasonCode.text: Severe abdominal pain accompanied by right flank pain

note.text: Patient had no specific medical or surgical history, irregular menstruation cycle, last menstruation occurred five weeks and six days previously. Blood tests showed low hemoglobin level, positive urinary pregnancy test, elevated serum β-HCG level. Gynecological sonography revealed no intrauterine pregnancy, normal bilateral adnexa with free fluid collection (suggestive of hemoperitoneum). APCT revealed hypervascular mass in subphrenic region with moderate hemoperitoneum. Diagnostic laparoscopic surgery performed, approximately 400 mL of blood and clots aspirated from pelvic cavity, hypervascular mass attached to diaphragm resected. Final pathologic diagnosis: ectopic pregnancy.
Diagnostic laparoscopic surgery performed, approximately 400 mL of blood and clots aspirated from pelvic cavity, hypervascular mass attached to diaphragm resected.

resource.valueString: Positive urinary pregnancy test, elevated serum β-HCG level

resource.description: Abdominopelvic computed tomography (APCT) revealed hypervascular mass in subphrenic region with moderate hemoperitoneum.

resource.title: Discharge Instructions
resource.description: Follow up with your primary care physician for further care. Take prescribed medications as directed by your healthcare provider. Avoid strenuous physical activity until cleared by your healthcare provider. Report any abdominal pain, vaginal bleeding, or dizziness to your healthcare provider immediately.
Follow up with the obstetrician-gynecologist for further evaluation and monitoring.
